Rooting is the process of allowing users of smartphones, tablets and other devices to gain privileged control over various Android subsystems.
If an exploit gains root access, ransomware could lock the user out of their device, or spyware could take over the camera, microphone, storage and even capture keyboard entry.
tuv.seg: Some users root devices to customize them, compromising the overall system and making the devices (and themselves) vulnerable.
Alguns usuários realizam o root de dispositivos para personalizá-los, comprometendo o sistema geral e deixando os dispositivos (e a si próprios) vulneráveis.

tuv.prop: From hardware to applications, Android has strong security built-in. Many businesses have experienced compromises and security is a primary concern for IT admins.
Google Play Protect arms devices with the most up-to-date security, detecting and blocking potentially harmful applications.
tuv.seg: All Android devices come with hardware-backed security and always-on data encryption.
Todos os dispositivos Android têm segurança baseada em hardware e criptografia de dados sempre ativa.

tuv.prop: Corporate or company-owned devices can be enabled for personal use with the same privacy and data protection as BYOD.
tuv.seg: It makes work and personal seamless yet secure within a single device.

tuv.prop: Man-in-the-middle attacks break the latter two assumptions by either corrupting the password or by capturing it.
tuv.seg: This can happen by network sniffing (a process of monitoring and capturing all data packets passing through a given network), which is why using public Wi-Fi can be a threat as poor security makes devices visible to each other.

Isso pode acontecer através do analisador de pacote (um processo de monitoramento e captura de todos os pacotes de dados que passam por uma determinada rede). É por isso que o uso de Wi-Fis públicas pode ser uma ameaça, pois a baixa segurança torna os dispositivos visíveis uns aos outros.
